means: （指成年女子，有些人尤其是长者认为这样说比较礼貌）女士
（在英国对女贵族或贵族成员的妻子女儿或爵士妻子的称呼）夫人
举止文雅且有教养的女子

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"女性"之意。
means: female与male"男(性)的，公的，雄的"相对，强调性别，可指人或动物，但除用于科学和统计上外，大多含贬义。
woman与man相对，侧重成年妇女的特点，系成年妇女的通称。
lady与gentleman相对，强调所谓高贵的气质、品德和教养等。也指对女性的礼貌称呼。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均表示对女性的尊称。
means: madam ： 夫人、太太，女士，小姐。与尊称男人的用词sir相对，多用于对已婚或未婚妇女的礼貌称呼，如店员对女顾客的称呼，后面不加姓名。如果已知对方的身份或姓名可在此词后面加上姓名职位。
Mrs ： 太太，夫人，是mistress的缩略形式，对已婚妇女的称呼。
lady ： 女士，夫人，与gentleman相对，是对女性的礼貌称呼，多用于演讲或祝酒时称呼在场的女性。
miss ： 小姐，是对未婚或不知婚姻状况的女性的称呼，与姓氏连用时应大写。

sentence.Network_en: Listen here, young lady. Don't you call me that!
sentence.Network_cn: 你给我听着，小姐。别那样叫我！

sentence.Network_en: In the past he dallied with actresses and lady novelists.
sentence.Network_cn: 他过去曾与许多女演员和女小说家调情。

sentence.Network_en: He bundled the old lady into her hallway and brutally attacked her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他将老妇人推到她家走廊上，并对她一顿暴打。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 此后，肯尼推出了一系列的上榜歌曲。如：莱昂纳尔·里奇创作的情歌《女士(lady)》（连续6周居美国榜首）、《我不需要你》（美国排行榜第1）、与希娜、伊斯顿、鲍博、塞格合作录制的《今.

第一夫人（First Lady）是一个尊称，适用于一个国家或联邦州领导人的妻子；如果领导人的配偶因各种原因而不能用胜任第一夫人的 …

phrase.cizu_name: it isn't over till the fat lady sings

jx.jx_en_mean: used to convey that there is still time for a situation to change
(informal, often derogatory)women with both the means and free time to meet each other socially for lunch in expensive restaurants
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，常贬)有钱有闲在高级饭店聚会午餐的女士

jx.jx_en_mean: a woman who engages in ostentatious acts of charity, more to impress others than out of a sense of concern for those in need
chance personified as a controlling power in human affairs

lj.lj_ly: it seemed Lady Luck was still smiling on them.
lj.lj_ls: 似乎幸运女神仍在对他们微笑。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)a haughty or pretentious woman (often as a mocking form of address)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)傲慢女士（常用作嘲笑称呼）

lj.lj_ly: it's that woman, Lady Muck herself—who does she think she is?.
lj.lj_ls: 就是那女人——傲慢女士——她以为自己是谁啊？。

jx.jx_en_mean: a polite form of address to female judges and certain noblewomen
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［对女法官和贵妇人的敬称］夫人

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hlǣfdīge (denoting a woman to whom homage or obedience is due, such as the wife of a lord or the mistress of a household, also specifically the Virgin Mary), from hlāf 'loaf' + a Germanic base meaning 'knead', related to dough; compare with lord. In Lady Day and other compounds where it signifies possession, it represents the Old English genitive hlǣfdīgan ('Our) Lady's'

encyclopedia.content: lady，有四个方面的含义：一是韩国演艺组合名称，该组合全部由男性变为女性的人员组成，倍受关注；二是一个英语单词，其意义是女士、夫人、小姐；三是《鬼泣3》故事里的人物，是巫女的后代；四是一首歌曲的名称，由肯尼罗杰斯演唱。

entry.tran: （尤为表示礼貌或尊敬的指称）女士；女子
entry.def: You can use lady when you are referring to a woman, especially when you are showing politeness or respect.

example.ex: She's a very sweet old lady...
example.tran: 她是一位很和蔼的老太太。

entry.def: You can say 'ladies' when you are addressing a group of women in a formal and respectful way.

example.ex: Your table is ready, ladies, if you'd care to come through...
example.tran: 你们的桌位已经准备好了，女士们，请跟我来。

entry.tran: （尤指旧时上层阶级的）贵妇，夫人，小姐
entry.def: A lady is a woman from the upper classes, especially in former times.

example.ex: ...the Empress and ladies of the Imperial Palace...
example.tran: 皇后与皇宫里的贵妇们

example.ex: Our governess was told to make sure we knew how to talk like English ladies.
example.tran: 要求家庭女教师教会我们英国贵妇般的谈吐。

entry.tran: （在英国用作对女贵族或爵士妻子的称谓）夫人，小姐
entry.def: In Britain, Lady is a title used in front of the names of some female members of the nobility, or the wives of knights.

example.ex: Cockburn's arrival coincided with that of Sir Iain and Lady Noble...
example.tran: 科伯恩到时正好伊恩爵士和诺布尔夫人也来了。

example.ex: My dear Lady Mary, how very good to see you.
example.tran: 亲爱的玛丽夫人，见到您真是太高兴了。

entry.def: If you say that a woman is a lady, you mean that she behaves in a polite, dignified, and graceful way.

example.ex: His wife was great as well, beautiful-looking and a real lady...
example.tran: 他妻子也很招人喜欢，样子俏丽，是位真正的淑女。

example.ex: A lady always sits quietly with her hands in her lap.
example.tran: 淑女端坐时总是双手放在膝上，不发一言。

entry.def: People sometimes refer to a public toilet for women as the ladies .

example.ex: At Temple station, Charlotte rushed into the Ladies.
example.tran: 一到坦普尔站，夏洛特立即冲进了女厕所。

entry.tran: （尤用于商店里或街上男子对不相识女子的称谓）女士，小姐
entry.def: 'Lady' is sometimes used by men as a form of address when they are talking to a woman that they do not know, especially in shops and in the street.

example.ex: What seems to be the trouble, lady?...
example.tran: 您遇到什么麻烦了吗，小姐？

example.ex: As she left the litter-strewn lot, an angry voice called out to her. 'Hey, lady!'
example.tran: 她正要离开满地垃圾的停车场，一个愤怒的声音朝她大嚷：“喂，小姐！”

means.word_mean: 1. a polite name for any woman;

sentences.sentence: "a nice lady at the library helped me"
"a chauffeur opened the door of the limousine for the grand lady"

list.explanation: 有权力的、威风凛凛的女人，盛气凌人的妇女，女强人

example.en: It was generally believed that she was a Dragon Lady.
example.zh: 当时她被公认为是个女强人。

auth_sentence.res_content: She said yes and wrote Lady Gaga on them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She said yes and wrote Lady Gaga on them.

auth_sentence.content: Does Lady Gaga have a penchant for peculiar hats?
auth_sentence.res_content: Does Lady Gaga have a penchant for peculiar hats?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Does Lady Gaga have a penchant for peculiar hats?

auth_sentence.content: He makes a worse advert than Lady Thatcher did.
auth_sentence.res_content: He makes a worse advert than Lady Thatcher did.

Sentence.sentence: And now, if you'll walk this way, ladies and gentlemen, the next room we're going to see is the room in which the family used to hold their formal dinner parties and even occasionally entertain heads of state and royalty.
As you can see, ladies and gentlemen, the guests were seated very informally around this oval table, which would add to the relaxed atmosphere
And now, ladies and gentlemen, if you'd like to follow me into the great hall…

means.word_mean: （指成年女子，有些人尤其是长者认为这样说比较礼貌）女士，女子

sentences.en: Ladies and gentlemen, it is time to begin.
sentences.cn: 各位女士, 先生, 该开会了。

sentences.en: There is a lady to see you, sir.
sentences.cn: 先生, 有位小姐要见你。

jushi.english: The old lady said that she was frightened to death by the earthquakes.
jushi.chinese: 那老太太说她被地震吓坏了。

jushi.english: When I was only three years old, my poor mother had to live in, cooking and washing for a rich lady.
jushi.chinese: 我才三岁的时候,我可怜的妈妈不得不住在一个阔太太的家里,给人家做饭、洗衣服。

jushi.english: The old lady insistently alleged that her daughter was murdered.
jushi.chinese: 那老太太坚持说她的女儿是被谋杀的。
